intro: Stenanthemum coronatum, commonly known as the Crowned Stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and Mediterranean climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
